resources.string: "Marcus Aurelius was a Roman Emperor and philosopher known for his writings, the Meditations, which are a valuable source of Stoic philosophy."
"Seneca was a Roman statesman and philosopher who applied Stoic ideas to the practical challenges of life, offering insights into resilience and self-control."
"Epictetus, a former slave, taught that freedom comes from mastering one's mind and emotions. His Discourses and Enchiridion are essential Stoic texts."
"Zeno of Citium founded the Stoic school of philosophy, teaching that happiness is found in accepting the present moment and avoiding destructive emotions."
"Cleanthes succeeded Zeno as the head of the Stoic school, emphasizing ethics and the unity of the universe governed by reason."
"Chrysippus, known as the second founder of Stoicism, expanded on Zeno's work and established many Stoic doctrines regarding logic, ethics, and physics."
